title: Authors and Citation
text: Schoch D (2025). dexid: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://schochastics.github.io/dexid/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dexid: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names},   author = {David Schoch},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://schochastics.github.io/dexid/}, }

what: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names
title: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names
text: Generate memorable identifiers combining adjectives Pokémon names. Inspired codename-style ID generators, package creates unique fun labels objects, files, projects.

title: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names
text: can install development version dexid GitHub :

title: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names
text: main function dexid() generates random identifiers combining adjectives Pokémon names. default, generates identifiers snake_case, can customize case style, number used adjectives, whether add random digits. package includes 1347 adjectives 1025 Pokémon names, allowing 1,380,675 unique combinations one adjective 1,859,769,225 unique combinations two adjectives.
code: library(dexid) set.seed(1234)  # Generate 5 basic snake_case IDs dexid(5) #> [1] "wild_enamorus"    "similar_landorus" "tame_garganacl"   "shiny_bibarel"    #> [5] "jumbo_kleavor"  # Generate 5 IDs with 2 adjectives for more uniqueness dexid(5, n_adj = 2) #> [1] "bitter_tangible_krokorok"        "misguided_envious_scovillain"    #> [3] "substantial_productive_frigibax" "disgusting_concerned_rotom"      #> [5] "improbable_adorable_zweilous"  # Generate 5 kebab case IDs dexid(5, case = "kebab") #> [1] "quarrelsome-okidogi"       "incompatible-crabominable" #> [3] "tedious-azurill"           "bulky-mudkip"              #> [5] "spiteful-slowpoke"  # Generate 5 IDs with random digits dexid(5, add_digits = TRUE) #> [1] "unknown_sigilyph_4590"  "educated_flareon_4629"  "mammoth_tinkaton_9346"  #> [4] "elastic_scyther_2901"   "quarterly_lampent_9737"  # Generate 5 IDs restrict to specific generation(s) dexid(5, gen = 1) #> [1] "rotten_weepinbell"   "delirious_raticate"  "liquid_victreebel"   #> [4] "insistent_poliwhirl" "fumbling_drowzee"

title: Generate Memorable Identifiers Using Pokémon Names
text: function dex_sentence() generates random sentence Pokémon using specific move can used identifier. sentence structure always adjective + Pokémon name + “uses” + move + adverb. 75,405,565,125 unique sentences available.
code: dex_sentence(5) #> [1] "Envious hippopotas uses water gun greatly" #> [2] "Growing petilil uses lovely kiss really"   #> [3] "Glum cobalion uses bubble beam wetly"      #> [4] "Phony sharpedo uses soft-boiled fondly"    #> [5] "Arid zapdos uses aurora beam fondly"

what: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
title: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
text: Generate Random sentences Pokémon using moves

title: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
text: n integer. Number IDs generate. gen vector integers. generations Pokemon use. Defaults generations. case Character string. case style use. Supported cases snake, kebab, camel, caps, sentence custom. case set custom, delimiter argument must provided. ... case set custom, delimiter argument must provided.

title: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
text: character vector length n containing generated sentences.

title: Generate Random sentences of Pokémon using moves — dex_sentence
code: dex_sentence(3) #> [1] "Glum scraggy uses meditate acidly"          #> [2] "Ashamed dachsbun uses lovely kiss strictly" #> [3] "Growing umbreon uses splash boldly"         dex_sentence(5) #> [1] "Giddy cottonee uses karate chop mortally"    #> [2] "Impish weepinbell uses bide regularly"       #> [3] "Stormy riolu uses thunder punch really"      #> [4] "Illustrious araquanid uses bind continually" #> [5] "Normal pancham uses water gun carefully"

what: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
text: Creates unique identifiers combining random adjectives Pokemon names different formats.

title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
code: dexid(   n,   n_adj = 1,   gen = 1:9,   case = c("snake", "kebab", "camel", "caps", "sentence", "custom"),   add_digits = FALSE,   ... )

title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
text: n integer. Number IDs generate. n_adj integer. Number adjectives use. Defaults 1. gen vector integers. generations Pokemon use. Defaults generations. case Character string. case style use. Supported cases snake, kebab, camel, caps, sentence custom. case set custom, delimiter argument must provided. add_digits Logical. TRUE, adds random digit end ID. Defaults FALSE. ... case set custom, delimiter argument must provided.

title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
text: character vector length n containing generated IDs.

title: Generate Random IDs Using Adjectives and Pokemon Names — dexid
code: # Generate 5 basic snake_case IDs dexid(5) #> [1] "complete_inkay"    "unlined_chewtle"   "advanced_snivy"    #> [4] "strong_ledyba"     "competent_linoone"  # Generate 5 IDs with 2 adjectives for more uniqueness dexid(5, n_adj = 2) #> [1] "long_mortified_wishiwashi"   "pricey_intrepid_solosis"     #> [3] "self-assured_wise_ribombee"  "bubbly_precious_basculegion" #> [5] "large_glass_ogerpon"          # Generate 5 kebab Case IDs dexid(5, case = "kebab") #> [1] "unsteady-buzzwole" "chief-thievul"     "smooth-dewott"     #> [4] "ample-lotad"       "blank-silvally"     # Generate 5 IDs with random digits dexid(5, add_digits = TRUE) #> [1] "naughty_tatsugiri_6984"  "practical_vigoroth_3432" #> [3] "acrobatic_umbreon_5050"  "shady_corviknight_2924"  #> [5] "infinite_gliscor_4632"    # Generate 5 IDs restrict to specific generation(s) dexid(5, gen = 1) #> [1] "unacceptable_charmander" "spry_zubat"              #> [3] "crowded_magneton"        "forceful_gengar"         #> [5] "unfinished_dratini"
